meanings.definition: A dramatic entertainment in which a single actor plays all the roles.
meanings.sent1: In the monodramas, the actor skillfully portrayed various characters without any other performers.
meanings.sent2: The monodramas showcased the versatility of the actor as they took on multiple roles in the performance.
meanings.sent3: During the monodramas, the audience was amazed at how one person could bring so many different characters to life.
meanings.sent4: The monodramas were like a one-person show where the actor transformed into a whole cast right before our eyes.
meanings.sent5: Watching the monodramas was like witnessing a theatrical chameleon embodying numerous personalities.

meanings.definition: A play in which a single character speaks alone.
meanings.sent1: The monodramas captivated the audience with the solo character delivering all the lines on stage.
meanings.sent2: During the monodramas, the lone character shared their thoughts and emotions with the audience.
meanings.sent3: In the monodramas, the character had the stage all to themselves, speaking their heart out.
meanings.sent4: The monodramas felt like a heartfelt soliloquy performed for an intimate audience.
meanings.sent5: The monodramas painted a vivid picture of solitude as the character expressed their innermost feelings.
